req_text: This specification uses the conformance verbs SHALL, SHOULD, and MAY as defined in RFC 2119. Unlike RFC 2119, however, this specification allows that different applications might not be able to interoperate because of how they use optional features. In particular:
SHALL: an absolute requirement for all implementations
SHALL NOT: an absolute prohibition against inclusion for all implementations

SHOULD/SHOULD NOT: A best practice or recommendation to be considered by implementers within the context of their particular implementation; there may be valid reasons to ignore an item, but the full implications must be understood and carefully weighed before choosing a different course

The contents of a resource and the formats used to represent resources SHALL conform to the rules described in this specification, as defined in the narrative of the specification, and as controlled by the conformance properties defined below.

Note that when present, elements cannot be empty - they SHALL have a value attribute, child elements, or extensions. The element's value attribute/property can never be empty. Either it is absent, or it is present with at least one character of non-whitespace content. This means that setting an element to a minimum cardinality of 1 does not ensure that data will be present; specific FHIRPath constraints are required to ensure that the required data will be present.

Clients should not depend on servers maintaining ordering of elements, unless the retrieved resource conforms to a profile which mandates maintenance of ordering. If a server cannot maintain ordering, it must strip off known profile tags which require maintenance of ordering, and strip off unknown profiles (since they might require maintenance of ordering).

Whether an element is a modifier cannot be changed when element usage is described in a constraining Structure Definition . When an element is labeled as Is-Modifier, the documentation must be clear about why it is a modifier.

If a narrative summary is present, and the status is generated , Is-Modifier elements SHALL be represented in the narrative summary of the resource. If Narrative is present with some other status Is-modifier elements SHOULD be represented.

The FHIR specification is primarily concerned with valid interfaces of various kinds (APIs, messaging, etc.) and the rules for the content in resource instances exchanged between applications. Implementation guides that describe specific implementation solutions and application roles are also concerned with application behavior - what information must be provided under what conditions, and setting expectations for how particular data elements are handled.

Many constraints are defined in the base specification. In addition, additional constraints may be defined in profiles that apply to resources. Systems are not required to evaluate the constraints, just as they are not required to check for conformance, or schema validity. However, systems SHOULD always ensure that all resources are valid against all applicable constraints.
AUTOSAR and the companies that have contributed to it shall not be liable for any use of the work.

2.1 Conventions used The key words "MUST", "MUST NOT", "REQUIRED", "SHALL", "SHALL NOT", "SHOULD", "SHOULD NOT", "RECOMMENDED", "MAY", and "OPTIONAL" in this document are to be interpreted as follows.
An implementation, which does not include a particular option, SHALL be prepared to interoperate with another implementation, which does include the option, though perhaps with reduced functionality.
In the same vein an implementation, which does include a particular option, SHALL be prepared to interoperate with another implemen- 9 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 4 Requirements Specification [RS_Main_00001] Real-Time System Software Platform Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00003, RS_PO_00004 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a software platform.
The AUTOSAR software platform shall be applicable for the domain of real-time systems.

Hard real time systems always have to deliver the correct result in the given time whereas from soft real time systems it is demanded that they compute the correct answer in a given time in a dedicated average. ⌋ [RS_Main_00060] Standardized Application Communication Interface Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00001, RS_PO_00002, RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide an application communication interface.
The AUTOSAR application communication interface shall allow AUTOSAR applications to use the same interface definition independently of whether they are located on the same or on different ECUs.

Rationale: A standardized interface definition for applications is a prerequisite for the reuse of software and hardware independent deployment. ⌋ [RS_Main_00130] Hardware Abstraction Layer Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00001, RS_PO_00002 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a hardware abstraction layer.
The AUTOSAR hardware abstraction layer shall standardize access to the hardware for software that is not part of the abstraction layer. ▽ 13 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 △ Rationale: Application software has to be independent from the underlying hardware in order to be reused (e.g. on other hardware platforms). ⌋ [RS_Main_00653] Means for Functional Modeling Status: DRAFT Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00002, RS_PO_00003, RS_PO_00004 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide means for functional modeling.
The AUTOSAR means for functional modeling shall be the same for AUTOSAR and Non-AUTOSAR platforms.

Rationale: To enable design of vehicles without the need to preselect a dedicated technology beforehand (AUTOSAR platforms, Non-AUTOSAR platforms) Dependencies: [RS_Main_00080], [RS_Main_00507] ⌋ [RS_Main_00230] Network Technology Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00002 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support E/E architectures that use more than one in vehicle network technology.
AUTOSAR shall support interconnection of networks via gateways, bridges and repeaters.

Rationale: Current in-vehicle E/E-architectures use multiple networks with different network technologies. ⌋ [RS_Main_00260] Runtime Diagnostics Means Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00004, RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide runtime diagnostics means.
The AUTOSAR runtime diagnostics means shall support the following standards (OBD, ISO14229) and protocols (UDS). ▽ 14 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 △ Rationale: Standardized diagnostics access is required for field service, approval and production. ⌋ [RS_Main_00280] Standardized Automotive Communication Protocols Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00003, RS_PO_00004, RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support standardized automotive communication protocols.
AUTOSAR shall support the communication between platforms defined by AUTOSAR and platforms defined by other parties (e.g. running other operating systems).

Rationale: Automotive networks consist of ECUs running different software platforms (including offboard systems) beside the software platforms defined by AUTOSAR. ⌋ [RS_Main_00491] Function Monitoring Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide function monitoring.
The AUTOSAR function monitoring shall include logging, distribution and storage of application-internal information at runtime.
The AUTOSAR function monitoring shall be usable without knowing anything about the ECU internal memory usage/addressing.
Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00510] Secure Onboard Communication Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide means for secure onboard communication.

The AUTOSAR means for secure onboard communication shall include at least means to check • data authenticity, • data integrity, • optionally confidentiality, • optionally data freshness. ⌋ [RS_Main_01001] Intra ECU Communication Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00002, RS_PO_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide intra ECU communication support.
The AUTOSAR intra ECU communication support shall enable software modules on the same ECU to communicate with each other with standardized means.

Rationale: Software modules send signals to each other to exchange algorithm data. ⌋ [RS_Main_00700] UDS Compliance Status: DRAFT Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall be compliant with the ISO 14229-2 standard for Unified Diagnostic Services (UDS).
Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00010] Safety Mechanisms Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide safety mechanisms.
The AUTOSAR safety mechanisms shall ensure freedom from interferences between safety relevant software modules.
The AUTOSAR safety mechanisms shall ensure safe inter and intra ECU communication.
The AUTOSAR safety mechanisms shall support the implementation of fail operational systems.
The AUTOSAR safety mechanisms shall include a methodology to support the configuration and documentation of safety relevant aspects.
The AUTOSAR safety mechanisms shall include a methodology how to implement safety by using the templates.

Platforms designed for the support of safety related systems are needed for safety related ECUs like digital engine control units and electronic power steering systems. ⌋ [RS_Main_00030] Safety Related Process Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00007, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide system safety support.
The AUTOSAR system safety support shall include at least exchange formats for safety process relevant information in the development process.
The AUTOSAR system safety support shall enable users to apply safety standards.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00011] Mechanisms for Reliable Systems Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide mechanisms for reliable systems.

Rationale: Reliability is one of the important characteristics to achieve safety. ⌋ [RS_Main_00012] Highly Available Systems Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide highly available systems support.
When system malfunction occurs during normal runtime then AUTOSAR highly available systems support shall ensure availability.

Highly available systems are required for automated driving applications. ⌋ [RS_Main_00080] Formal Description Language Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00004, RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a formal description language.
The AUTOSAR formal description language shall allow users to describe AUTOSAR software.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00190] Non-AUTOSAR Software Integration Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00003, RS_PO_00004 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support AUTOSAR users to integrate non AUTOSAR-compliant software into AUTOSAR software.

Rationale: Users want to reuse proprietary software or software based on former AUTOSAR versions. ⌋ [RS_Main_00200] Resource Efficiency Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00002 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall al- low AUTOSAR users to implement AUTOSAR software efficiently with respect to • RAM • ROM, Flash • Computing power • Bus bandwith.

Rationale: Limited resources like flash, RAM, computing power characterize automotive computers. ⌋ [RS_Main_00507] Development Collaboration Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00001, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide development collaboration support.
The AUTOSAR development collaboration support shall include processes, exchange formats and methodology.
Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00514] System Security Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide system security support.
The AUTOSAR system security support shall provide security mechanisms.
The AUTOSAR system security support shall provide security properties.

The AUTOSAR security properties shall at least include • authenticity, • confidentiality, • integrity, • non-repudiation. ⌋ [RS_Main_00180] Intellectual Property Protection Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide intellectual property protection.
The AUTOSAR intellectual property protection shall secure the intellectual property of development artifacts exchanged between parties.
AppliesTo: FO ⌋ [RS_Main_00270] Backward Compatibility Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00001, RS_PO_00002 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide Backward Compatibility means.
The AUTOSAR Backward Compatibility means shall enable users to assess how to migrate from AUTOSAR release n to AUTOSAR release n+1. ▽ 20 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main
AppliesTo: FO ⌋ [RS_Main_00350] Documented Software Architecture Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a documented software architecture.
The AUTOSAR documented software architecture shall enable users to perform a safety analysis according to ISO26262.
Supporting Material: ISO26262 ⌋ [RS_Main_00360] Variant Management Support Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00002 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide variant management support.
The AUTOSAR variant management support shall enable users to ensure the compatibility of application software across vehicle variants and vehicle software releases.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 5 Platform Level Candidates [RS_Main_00460] AUTOSAR shall standardize methods to organize mode man- agement on Application, ECU and System level Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a method to configure mode management mechanisms for Application Software to control or react on modes of the ECU or vehicle.
These specified test cases and its related methodology shall be developed to test implementations of AUTOSAR basic software.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00250] AUTOSAR methodology shall provide a predefinition of typical roles and activities Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: The definition and description of roles and activities in the design methodology should support a work-share model.
Rationale: As AUTOSAR enables work-share on different positions and activities it shall provide a common understanding of roles and activities.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Share activities like AUTOSAR configuration and Application Software partitioning between software integrator and software architect. ⌋ [RS_Main_00300] AUTOSAR shall provide data exchange formats to support work-share in large inter and intra company development groups Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support the work-share in large development projects via well-defined exchange formats.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Data sharing between OEM and 1st Tier supplier. ⌋ [RS_Main_00320] AUTOSAR shall provide formats to specify system develop- ment Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00004, RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: In AUTOSAR it shall be possible to describe all requirements of Application Software to their platform environment.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 △ AppliesTo: FO Use Case: OEM designs an Application Software and a Supplier will integrate these AUTOSAR Software Applications on an ECU. ⌋ [RS_Main_00340] AUTOSAR shall support the continuous timing requirement analysis Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support observation, assessment and methodology of timing requirements throughout the development cycle.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Real time control of today’s gasoline injection system. ⌋ [RS_Main_00500] AUTOSAR shall provide naming conventions Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00007 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall define naming conventions for internal and external symbols created and used by the standard.
Rationale: Naming conventions shall be defined in specification documents to achieve a standardized and consistent documentation.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00002] AUTOSAR shall provide a software platform for high perfor- mance computing platforms Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a software platform called AUTOSAR Adaptive Platform, which targets the domain of automotive applications with high demands regarding computing power and memory.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Development of applications for automated driving and advanced driving assistance systems ⌋ [RS_Main_00400] AUTOSAR shall provide a layered software architecture Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a software architecture, which distinguishes between Application Software, a Runtime Environment and Basic Software.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00501] AUTOSAR shall support redundancy concepts Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00010, RS_Main_00011 ⌈ Description: In engineering, redundancy is the duplication of critical components or functionalities of a system with the intention of increasing reliability of the system.
AUTOSAR shall support the freedom from interference according to ISO26262.

Supporting Material: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Redundancy_(engineering) http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Active_redundancy ⌋ [RS_Main_00511] AUTOSAR shall support virtualization Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00130 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support virtualization in a way that it can be hosted and executed as a guest operating system in a virtualized environment.
Rationale: It shall be possible to run AUTOSAR on top of existing hypervisor solutions.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Development of ECUs which contain infotainment as well as control functionality ⌋ [RS_Main_00420] AUTOSAR shall use established software standards and con- solidate de-facto standards for basic software functionality Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: The different solutions for basic software functionalities shall be consolidated to a single standard.
Whenever possible AUTOSAR shall make use of existing standards provided that they meet the given requirements. ▽ 27 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main
To achieve a common standard, which is accepted and used by all of the participating partners these solutions shall be consolidated by AUTOSAR.
If an agreed common solution supported by OEMs and Tier 1 already exists, this solution shall be adopted by AUTOSAR in order to ease reuse of existing software.

POSIX ⌋ [RS_Main_00440] AUTOSAR shall standardize access to non-volatile memory Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00130 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall standardize access to non-volatile memory for code and data memory.
Rationale: Since the current AUTOSAR memory stack only targets non-volatile data memory access, adding the statement clarifies that the memory stack shall also be capable of accessing code memory.

AppliesTo: AP, CP Use Case: NV data storage, software update (OTA, flash bootloader) ⌋ [RS_Main_00445] AUTOSAR shall standardize access to crypto-specific HW and SW Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00510 ⌈ Description: The AUTOSAR platforms shall support access to crypto and security related Hardware and define Software to access those.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00170] AUTOSAR shall provide secure access to ECU data and ser- vices Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00510, RS_Main_00010, RS_Main_00030, RS_Main_00514 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide secured access to ECU data and services by secure authentication of external ECU users.

Use Case: Secure V2X connection ⌋ [RS_Main_00650] AUTOSAR shall support up - and download of data and soft- ware Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00653, RS_Main_00280 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support standardized up- and download of data and software.
For all kind of data exchange between off- and onboard artifacts mechanisms and methods shall be defined.
These mechanisms and methods shall support common protocols used for data-transfer.
Partial updates of the software shall be supported.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: Download of dedicated Software Components in ECU. ⌋ [RS_Main_00261] AUTOSAR shall provide means for calibration Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00260, RS_Main_00360 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a unified way for off- and onboard data calibration.
The calibration data shall be accessable by Applications.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00026] AUTOSAR shall support high speed and high bandwidth com- munication between executed SW Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00280, RS_Main_00012 ⌈ Description: The middleware shall support high speed and high bandwidth communication between executed SW.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: High-bandwidth data like image or sensor data is exchanged between components within automotive networks. ⌋ [RS_Main_01002] AUTOSAR shall support service-oriented communication Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support service-oriented communication between applications independently of the location of the applications.

AppliesTo: AP Dependencies: RS_Main_00150 Use Case: A parking assistant application wants to use camera and radar services. ⌋ [RS_Main_01003] AUTOSAR shall support data-oriented communication Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support data-oriented communication between applications.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_01025] AUTOSAR shall support debugging of software on the target and onboard Status: DRAFT Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a standardized method and interface to enable debugging the software of AUTOSAR systems with awareness of the AUTOSAR architecture.
If a module provides methods of obtaining internal state information to be used by debuggers then it shall use this standardized method.
Components and modules implementing this requirement shall provide the necessary state information that can be used by internal and external tools.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Debugging the software. ⌋ [RS_Main_01026] AUTOSAR shall support tracing and profiling on the target and onboard Status: DRAFT Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a standardized method and interface to enable tracing and profiling the software of AUTOSAR systems with awareness of the AUTOSAR architecture.
If a module provides methods of obtaining internal event information to be used by trace analysis tools, then it shall use this standardized method.
Components and modules implementing this requirement shall provide the necessary details and hooks that can be used by tools.
Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00503] AUTOSAR shall support change of communication and appli- cation software at runtime.

Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: Advanced systems require dynamic allocation of AUTOSAR Applications and adaptations of the communication topology after development and production at life-time of the system AUTOSAR shall provide a technical possibility which provides these Software changes at runtime.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: Update of Application Software or update of configuration over the air ⌋ [RS_Main_01004] AUTOSAR shall support standards for wireless off-board com- munication Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00280 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR communication shall support standards for wireless off-board communication.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: Services for automotive applications can be provided in cloud instances or vehicle backend ⌋ [RS_Main_01008] AUTOSAR shall provide secure communication with off-board entities Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00280 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR communication shall provide secure communication with off-board entities.
Rationale: Data should be securely transferred between the vehicle and off-board entities to protect data integrity, privacy and prevent misuse.
AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Purchasing applications or unlocking functionality through the headunit HMI should be safe and secure. ⌋ 32 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_01005] AUTOSAR shall establish communication paths dynamically Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR communication shall establish communication paths dynamically.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: A service is selected based on availability of sensor data. ⌋ [RS_Main_01007] AUTOSAR communication shall assure quality of service on communication Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR communication shall assure quality of service on communication Rationale: Some applications are sensitive to delays in signal reception.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: An algorithm in the ESP needs data from the wheel sensors with low-latency and guaranteed reception. ⌋ [RS_Main_00129] AUTOSAR shall tolerate unexpected communication elements.

Status: DRAFT Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00270 ⌈ Description: If unanticipated elements of a communication (e.g. new data elements of a serialized data package) are received, AUTOSAR tolerant communication mechanisms shall not invalidate the communication behaviour for anticipated communication elements.
Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00131] Communication filtering mechanisms Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support communication filtering mechanisms.
The AUTOSAR communication filtering mechanisms shall be configurable by the means of the AUTOSAR formal description language.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: To mitigate potential attackers from taking control of vehicular functions and protect against denial-of-service attacks ⌋ [RS_Main_00049] AUTOSAR shall provide an Execution Management for running multiple applications Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: The middleware shall provide an execution framework for adaptive SWCs.
To support this, the execution management should be able to facilitate lifecycle operations for numerous SWCs.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: The execution management starts all required SWCs at system initialization. ⌋ [RS_Main_00050] AUTOSAR shall provide an Execution Framework towards ap- plications to implement concurrent application internal control flows Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00460, RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide an Execution Framework towards applications to implement concurrent application internal control flows.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00106] AUTOSAR shall provide the possibility to extend the software with new SWCs without recompiling the platform foundation Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001, RS_Main_00300 ⌈ Description: It shall be possible to extend AUTOSAR with new SWCs without recompiling the platform foundation Rationale: To prevent unnecessary build time, individual SWCs should be able to be compiled independently without the need to recompile all other system software.

AppliesTo: AP Use Case: A new SWC is introduced to an ECU implementation at a later point in time during the SW project. ⌋ [RS_Main_00100] AUTOSAR shall provide standardized Basic Software Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00001, RS_PO_00007, RS_Main_00130, RS_Main_00060 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall provide a complete functional specification of the Basic Software including interfaces and behavioral description.
AppliesTo: CP Use Case: Application Software shall be useable on multiple implementations of the Basic Software. ⌋ 35 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00430] AUTOSAR shall support established automotive communica- tion standards Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00280 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR ECUs shall support common established communication systems.
These shall be supported by AUTOSAR.

AppliesTo: CP Use Case: Implementation of distributed functionality e. g. driving assistance systems ⌋ [RS_Main_00435] AUTOSAR shall support automotive microcontrollers Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00001 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support hardware features of commonly used automotive microcontrollers.
The AUTOSAR shall support the integrated features of these microcontrollers.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00450] AUTOSAR shall standardize access to general purpose I/O Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00130 ⌈ Description: The AUTOSAR Basic Software shall support access to general purpose I/O.

Rationale: Software Components need to access application specific hardware (sensor and actuators) AppliesTo: CP Use Case: Temperature sensor for engine control. ⌋ [RS_Main_00651] AUTOSAR shall support mirroring of CAN, LIN, and FlexRay to CAN, FlexRay, Ethernet, or proprietary networks Status: DRAFT ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support direct forwarding of CAN, LIN, and FlexRay frames from multiple source buses to a destination CAN or FlexRay bus, to Ethernet, or to a proprietary network (CDD).

The following forwardings shall be supported: • LIN/CAN -> CAN • LIN/CAN/CAN-FD -> CAN-FD • LIN/CAN/CAN-FD/FlexRay -> CAN XL • LIN/CAN/CAN-FD/FlexRay -> FlexRay • LIN/CAN/CAN-FD/FlexRay -> Ethernet • LIN/CAN/CAN-FD/FlexRay -> CDD Rationale: It is not always possible or sometimes just too complicated to connect an analysis tool directly to an internal network.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00301] AUTOSAR shall specify profiles for data exchange to support work-share in large inter- and intra-company development groups Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00060, RS_Main_00300, RS_Main_00250 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR shall support the work-share in large development projects via the definition of common data exchange points and profiles which provide guidance with respect to completeness and correctness of data at these data exchange points.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00121] Acceptance tests shall minimize test effort and test costs Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00120 ⌈ Description: In order to avoid redundant test cycles and ease the reuse of test results for users of AUTOSAR standard, acceptance tests shall focus on reduction of test effort and test costs.
Test concept shall address explicitly efficiency.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00123] Acceptance tests shall test interoperability of BSW implemen- tations in vehicle networks Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00120 ⌈ Description: Acceptance tests shall test interoperability of BSW implementations in vehicle networks.

Rationale: BSW is supplied from various sources and suppliers Use Case: heterogenic vehicle networks of ECUs from different suppliers and gateways ⌋ [RS_Main_00124] Acceptance tests shall test interoperability of BSW implemen- tations to applications Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00120 ⌈ Description: Acceptance tests shall test interoperability of BSW implementations to applications.

Use Case: Strategic, abstract and generic application development Support for different development cycles for applications and BSW implementations ⌋ [RS_Main_00125] Acceptance tests shall provide means to measure the BSW implementation maturity Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00120 ⌈ Description: Acceptance tests shall provide a reference to measure maturity.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00128] Acceptance tests shall cover a commonly agreed subset of AUTOSAR requirements Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00120 ⌈ Description: Acceptance tests shall cover a commonly agreed subset of AUTOSAR requirements.

Use Case: Specification and implementation effort focussed on the features or test cases with the highest market needs ⌋ [RS_Main_00490] AUTOSAR processes shall be compliant to ISO26262 Upstream requirements: RS_Main_00030 ⌈ Description: To develop safety related automotive systems all processes applied need to follow the corresponding requirements given in ISO26262.Accordingly the applicable process related requirements of ISO26262 have to be fulfilled by AUTOSAR processes.
Rationale: AUTOSAR shall support the development of systems according to the highest ASIL.

AppliesTo: FO Use Case: Development of safety related automotive systems, e.g. to achieve high availability and fail-operational systems for highly automated driving Supporting Material: ISO26262 ⌋ [RS_Main_00512] AUTOSAR shall support time synchronization Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009 ⌈ Description: The AUTOSAR platforms shall support a time synchronization of ECUs with multiple timebases over automotive communication busses.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 [RS_Main_00285] AUTOSAR shall support protocols for Intelligent Transporta- tion Systems Upstream requirements: RS_PO_00003, RS_PO_00004, RS_PO_00005, RS_PO_00009, RS_- PO_00010 ⌈ Description: AUTOSAR communication shall support geo-networking, transport protocols and facility protocols for Vehicle-2-X applications as defined by ETSI Rationale: Geo-networking (GN) and the basic transport protocol (BTP) are essential components of a V2X stack.

Main Requirements AUTOSAR FO R24-11 △ Number Heading [RS_Main_01026] AUTOSAR shall support tracing and profiling on the target and onboard Table A.2: Changed Requirements in R23-11 A.2.3 Deleted Requirements in R23-11 none 46 of 46 Document ID 54: AUTOSAR_FO_RS_Main
Trick source code shall use a POSIX compliant API when accessing POSIX threads (pthreads), mutual exclusions (mutexes), signals, interrupts, and clock routines. [Trick-151]
Trick shall save the number of command line arguments.
Trick shall save all command line arguments.
Trick shall determine and save the current directory of the simulation executable.
Trick shall determine and save the current name of the simulation executable.
Trick shall determine and save the current directory of the run input file.
Trick shall use the run input directory as the default output directory.
Trick shall allow the user to override the output directory.
Trick shall provide the option to create timestamped subdirectories within the output directory.
Data Recording shall provide the capability to record one or more variables that a user has specified in a log group.
Data Recording shall provide the capability to record multiple log groups.
Data Recording shall time tag the recorded data with the simulation time.
Data Recording shall provide the capability to record each log group at its own user specified frequency
Data Recording shall provide the capability to record each log group only when user specified model data changes.
Data Recording shall provide the capability to write data to disk without affecting the real-time performance of the simulation.
Trick shall not preclude that which cannot be precluded unless Trick is precluded from not precluding the unprecludable.
Trick shall plant a tree for every successful simulation built.
Trick shall be dolphin safe.
Trick shall recycle.
Trick shall track simulation elapsed time by an integer count of tics/second
Trick shall initialize simulation elapsed time after all initialization class jobs have completed.
Trick shall increment simulation elapsed time to the next lowest job call time greater than the current simulation time after all jobs at the current simulation time have completed.
Trick shall provide an initialization mode.
Trick shall provide a run mode.
Trick shall provide a freeze mode.
Trick shall provide an exit mode.
Trick shall provide a mode command to transition to Freeze.
Trick shall provide a mode command to transition to Run.
Trick shall provide a mode command to transition to Shutdown.
Trick shall provide a method for adding simulation objects to the scheduler prior to execution.
Trick shall order jobs by job_class, then phase, then sim_object id, then job_id.
Trick shall execute periodic scheduled jobs during simulation run mode (all scheduled types).
Trick shall execute periodic freeze jobs during simulation freeze mode (freeze).
Trick shall execute periodic scheduled jobs during simulation run mode at the end of a settable software_frame (end_of_frame).
Trick shall assign the initial call time for a periodic job to the current simulation time + job offset.
Trick shall reschedule subsequent job call times for a periodic job to the current simulation time + job cycle.
Trick shall execute discrete job execution scheduling on simulation startup (default_data).
Trick shall execute discrete job execution scheduling during simulation initialization (initialization).
Trick shall execute of discrete job execution scheduling upon entering simulation freeze (freeze_init).
Trick shall execute of discrete job execution scheduling upon exiting simulation freeze (unfreeze).
Trick shall execute discrete job execution scheduling during simulation termination (shutdown).
Trick shall provide a method for inserting a job before each initialization and each scheduled job within a simulation.
Trick shall provide a method for inserting a job before a single initialization or scheduled job within a simulation.
Trick shall provide a method for inserting a job after each initialization and each scheduled job within a simulation.
Trick shall provide a method for inserting a job after a single initialization or scheduled job within a simulation.
Trick shall provide a method for removing instrumentation job(s).
Trick shall support single threaded execution during all modes of operation.
Trick shall support multiple threads of execution during run mode.
Trick shall support child threads that synchronize execution with each time step of the parent thread (synchronous thread).
Trick shall support child threads that does not synchronize execution with the parent thread. Thread jobs are restarted at next available time step from the master thread. (asynchronous thread)

Trick shall support child threads that does synchronizes execution with the parent thread at a specified interval. This interval may be greater than a time step in the parent thread (asynchronous must finish (AMF) thread).
Trick shall spawn enough threads to accomodate jobs listed within the S_define file.
Trick shall provide inter-thread job dependencies. This ensures pre-requesite jobs are completed before current job execution.
Trick shall terminate simulation execution if a child thread exits.
Trick shall assign signal handlers to attempt a graceful shutdown of the simulation when the following signals occur: SIGINT, SIGTERM, SIGBUS, SIGSEGV, SIGFPE.
Trick shall assign signal handlers to handle the SIGCHLD signal.

Trick shall attempt to terminate the simulation gracefully when a SIGTERM, SIGBUS, or SIGSEGV signal is caught. Program corruption at this point may be too great to complete this requirement, hence "attempt".
Trick shall allow the user to assign the system default signal handlers for the signals SIGBUS, SIGSEGV, or SIGFPE signals.
Trick shall provide a framework to use a real-time clock source.
The framework shall provide a base real-time clock class that provides an interface to initialize the clock.
The framework shall provide a base real-time clock class that provides an interface to return the current time.
The framework shall provide a base real-time clock class that provides an interface to reset the clock.
The framework shall provide a base real-time clock class that provides an interface to wait/spin on the clock to reach a requested time.
The framework shall provide a base real-time clock class that provides an interface to stop the clock.
Trick shall provide a real-time clock based on the system gettimeofday clock (GetTimeofDay Clock).
Trick shall be capable of synchronizing simulation time to a real-time clock.
Trick shall be capable of running non-real-time.
Trick shall provide the capability to switch between real-time and non-real-time execution.
Trick shall detect when the current simulation job execution frame takes longer than the real-time frame (overrun).
Trick shall provide the option to respond to simulation overruns by continuing to next frame of execution.
Trick shall provide the option to respond to simulation overruns by freezing.
Trick shall provide the option to respond to simulation overruns by terminating.
The overrun criteria to cause a response shall be either a single large overrun of a user specified size (in seconds), or a user specified number of overruns is detected.
Trick shall detect when the current simulation job execution frame is equal to or shorter than the real-time frame (underrun).
Trick shall wait for real-time to catch up to the simulation time before starting the next frame of execution during an underrun.
Trick shall provide the option to release the processor (sleep) during an underrun.
Trick shall store an ordered queue of jobs of the same scheduling class. The order shall be based on job class, phase number, sim_object order, and finally order of jobs within the simulation object.
Trick shall provide a method to add simulation objects to the queue.
Trick shall provide a method to add simulation objects to the queue that ignores the sim_object and job order.
Trick shall provide a method to clear the job queue.
Trick shall provide a method to get the next job on the list.
Trick shall provide a method to search for the next job on the list whose next job call time matches the current simulation time.
Trick shall provide a method to reset the search index to the top of the list.
Trick shall track the lowest next job call time greater than the current call time.
Trick shall provide a method to retrieve the next job call time.
Trick shall provide a method to insert a job before each job in the queue.
Trick shall provide a method to insert a job before a single job in the queue.
Trick shall provide a method to insert a job after each job in the queue.
Trick shall provide a method to insert a job after a single job in the queue.
Trick shall provide a framework to use a sleep timer.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to initialize the timer.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to start the timer.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to reset the timer.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to wait on the timer to expire.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to stop the timer.
The framework shall provide a base timer class that provides an interface to shutdown the timer.
Trick shall provide a sleep timer based on the system itimer (ITimer timer).

ERA * UNISIG * EEIG ERTMS USERS GROUP SUBSET-026-2 3.6.0 13/05/2016 System Requirements Specification Chapter 2 Basic System Description Page 20/25 2.6.5.2 Summary of characteristics of Application Level 1 2.6.5.2.1 Trackside equipment:  Eurobalises for spot transmission from track to train.  Eurobalises must be able to transmit variable information.  Semi continuous infill transmission by using Euroloop or radio infill is optional.
